::Prowl::

Prowl raises an eyebrow at Iron Raptor's statement about the 
Cybertronian Fire holding up. He didn't think it was wise to assume 
that, but she was the commander here. However, last time the Maximals 
fought the Alliance, there were a few casualties on the Maximal side. 
Prowl also knew that Kluster wouldn't have sounded like that if this 
wasn't an emergency.

-You're taking the Alliance attack way too lightly, love,- he thinks 
to Iron Raptor, -There are three confirmed Gestalt groups in the 
battle already, all fighting for the Alliance. Oblitertron nearly 
killed me with just one attack. If all the gestalts have that power, 
than this battle is going to be barely won at best.-

He didn't add his thoughts on the worst-case scenario, but Iron 
Raptor could easily pick them up.

"If they track you to the base, then there is a chance that they 
engage the Alliance," Prowl says and the frowns, "Unless they're with 
the Alliance or something."

Prowl watches the two cats fly off. He walks up to Iron Raptor and 
tries to slide an arm around her. -I just recieved a transmission 
from Arcangel. Sounds like they need us back there.-

Prowl frowns, looking around the forest. What did these new things 
that had scared the slag out of Snow Tech and Shadow Cat want? Why 
did the Alliance have to choose now to attack? Why was the sky blue? 

(Ok, he didn't think that last one, it was just something that looked 
cool to put in)
